alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 10 at 7:44PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE ... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A tropical circulation has formed a little north of the CNMI. This system is forecast to slowly strengthen, as it gradually heads off to the west, while placing the Marianas and the CNMI in a monsoon flow for the middle to end of the upcoming week. There remains some disagreement in timing, location, and duration of the heavier rainfall potential amongst the various model forecasts. Any stronger shower or thunderstorm may also produce strong wind gusts. Timing: Wednesday afternoon through Friday afternoon. Locations: The Mariana Islands Amounts: Northern CNMI - 5 to 8 inches Tinian and Saipan - 3 to 5 inches Guam and Rota - 2 to 4 inches Note: All locations may see locally higher rainfall totals Should this occur as forecast, urban and small stream flooding would be a possibility. Closely monitor this developing situation in the event watches, advisories, or warnings are needed. Forecasts will likely change in the next few days. Make sure nearby storm drains are not clogged, especially for low-lying or flood-prone areas.
